purpleculture_info: Ideographic: The stomach ⺼ behind the abdominal muscles 田
purpleculture_examples:
胃口 [ wèi kǒu ]: appetite; liking
胃病 [ wèi bìng ]: stomach trouble; stomach illness
肠胃 [ cháng wèi ]: stomach and intestine; digestive system
脾胃 [ pí wèi ]: spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM); preferences; one's taste (e.g. in literature)
胃炎 [ wèi yán ]: gastritis
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 田 [ tián ] field, farm, arable land; cultivated
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
heisig_chinese_memo: The rice field is harvested once a month to get food for our stomachs.
heisig_constituent: stomach, rice field, brains, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
heisig_story: You will need to refer back to frames 13 and 14 here for the special meaning of the two primitive elements that make up this character: flesh (part of the body) and brain. What the kanji says, if you look at it, is that the part of the body that keeps the brain in working order is the stomach. To keep the elements in proper order, when you write this kanji think of the brain as being "held up" by the flesh.
koohiiStory1: The rice field is harvested once a month to get food for our stomach.
koohiiStory2: The stomach is the part of the body that digests food (which, in Japan, is mainly rice).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you eat a rice paddy the size of the moon, your stomach is going to hurt. All the rice in a rice paddy the size of the moon is way too much rice for anyone to consume. If you do, your stomach is going to ache like crazy.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having a whole rice paddy in your stomach. A rice paddy the size of the moon. Your stomach hurts a lot. You feel like you’re going to throw up.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: From the sky, an eagle swoops down and flies right into your distended stomach. Bam! The eagle (い) hits your stomach and you vomit up the entire moon sized rice paddy.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This eagle saw your stomach distress and decided to help by making you barf. Hear the screech of the eagle as it swoops down and rams you in the stomach.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the body part (⺼) that absorbs the rice (田) is the stomach
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The rice field is harvested once a month to get food for our stomachs.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from " flesh " from " ◎ ". " ◎ " resembles the stomach shape, which is the original text of " stomach ". The middle points resemble the grains in the stomach, until the small seal is " rice ", which is called " 𡇒 ". After adding "肉" as a symbol. "Said Wen": "𦞅, Gu Fu also. Cong meat; 𡇒, pictogram." "Lingshu Sutra. "Five flavors": "The stomach is the sea of the five Tibetans and six provinces. All water and valleys enter the stomach, and the five Tibetans and six provinces all have qi in the stomach."

The inscription " Stomach " is used as the surname, and "Weigong Decoction uses its lucky gold." It was also used as a " predicate ", the Shaoya sword: "I have more than a name, the stomach (predicted) of the Shaoya." The pre-Qin and Han Dynasties often used " stomach " as " predicate ", "Sleeping Tiger Land. Japanese Book B": "It is the stomach (that is) expensive than cheap". "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Jia Ben": "The two come out of the same name, but have the same name with the same stomach (predicted)".

In addition, the Xinyang Chujian and Guodian Chujian “is the stomach”, pronounced as “being”, just like “being”. "Zuo Zhuan. "The 22nd Year of Zhuang Gong": "It is the light of the country." "Historical Records. "Chen Family" is "For the Light of Viewing the Country". See " predicate ", " 𦳊 ", " shit ".

In later generations, " stomach " was added with meat as " 𦝩 ", " Ri ·Nei Ze": " Buddha Olu stomach". "Explanation": "The stomach is also made 𦝩."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " flesh " from " ◎ ". " ◎ " resembles the stomach shape, which is the original text of " stomach ".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「肉」從「◎」。「◎」象胃形，為「胃」之初文。中間數點象胃臟中的穀米形，至小篆訛為「米」，作「𡇒」。後加「肉」旁作為義符。《說文》：「𦞅，穀府也。從肉；𡇒，象形。」《靈樞經．五味》：「胃者，五藏六府之海也，水穀皆入于胃，五藏六府皆稟氣于胃。」

　　金文「胃」用作姓氏，胃公鼎：「胃公湯用其吉金」。又用作「謂」，少虡劍：「朕余名之，胃(謂)之少虡。」先秦兩漢多以「胃」為「謂」，《睡虎地．日書乙種》：「是胃(謂)貴勝賤」。《馬王堆．老子甲本》：「兩者同出，異名同胃(謂)」。

　　此外，信陽楚簡、郭店楚簡「是胃」，讀作「是謂」，猶「是為」。《左傳．莊公二十二年》：「是謂觀國之光」。《史記．陳𣏌世家》作「是為觀國之光」。參見「謂」、「𦳊」、「屎」。

　　後世「胃」又加肉旁作「𦝩」，《禮•內則》：「鴇奧鹿胃」。《釋文》：「胃又作𦝩。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「肉」從「◎」。「◎」象胃形，為「胃」之初文。

金文從「 肉 」從「 ◎ 」。「 ◎ 」象胃形，為「 胃 」之初文。中間數點象胃臟中的穀米形，至小篆訛為「 米 」，作「 𡇒 」。後加「 肉 」旁作為義符。《說文》：「𦞅，穀府也。從肉；𡇒，象形。」《靈樞經．五味》：「胃者，五藏六府之海也，水穀皆入于胃，五藏六府皆稟氣于胃。」 金文「 胃 」用作姓氏，胃公鼎：「胃公湯用其吉金」。又用作「 謂 」，少虡劍：「朕余名之，胃(謂)之少虡。」先秦兩漢多以「 胃 」為「 謂 」，《睡虎地．日書乙種》：「是胃(謂)貴勝賤」。《馬王堆．老子甲本》：「兩者同出，異名同胃(謂)」。 此外，信陽楚簡、郭店楚簡「是胃」，讀作「是謂」，猶「是為」。《左傳．莊公二十二年》：「是謂觀國之光」。《史記．陳𣏌世家》作「是為觀國之光」。參見「 謂 」、「 𦳊 」、「 屎 」。 後世「 胃 」又加肉旁作「 𦝩 」，《禮•內則》：「鴇奧鹿胃」。《釋文》：「胃又作𦝩。」

胃字的基本解释

胃
wèi
人和脊椎动物身体里主管消化食物的器官：胃脏。胃液。胃酸。胃口（食欲，引申为兴趣、欲望。“口”读轻声）。
星名，二十八宿之一。

胃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wèi］
［《廣韻》于貴切，去未，云。］
亦作“1”。
(1)动物容纳和消化食物的器官。
(2)星宿名。二十八宿之一。西方白虎七宿的第三宿。
(3)通“謂”。多见于出土帛书、竹简。
(4)通“畏”。亦见于出土文物。

胃字的英文翻译

◎ 胃
stomach, paunch, tummy

胃字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　胃； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页977第06
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】于貴切【正韻】于畏切，?音謂。【說文】穀府也。从?从肉，象形。【玉篇】白虎通曰：胃者，脾之府，穀之委，故脾稟氣於胃。【廣韻】腸胃。【釋名】胃，圍也，圍受食物也。【禮·內則】鴇奧鹿胃。【史記·貨殖傳】胃脯?微耳，濁氏連騎。【註】晉灼曰：今大官常以十月作沸湯，燖羊胃，以末椒薑扮之，暴使燥，是也。　又【韻會】西方宿名。【禮·月令】季春之月，日在胃。【史記·天官書】胃爲天倉。【註】胃主倉稟，五穀之府也。明則天下和平，五穀豐稔。　又【集韻】本作?。【禮·內則】鴇奧鹿胃。【釋文】胃又作?。又?。

胃字的源字形

胃字的起名意思

人和某些动物的消化器官之一。

stomach
Basic explanation of words
stomach
wèi
The organ responsible for digesting food in humans and vertebrates: the stomach. Gastric juice. Stomach acid. Appetite (appetite, extended to interest, desire. "Mouth" read softly).
Star name, one of twenty-eight places.
stomach
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wèi］
["Guangyun" Yu Guiqie, Quwei, Yun. ]
Also called "1".
(1) An animal's organ for holding and digesting food.
(2) The name of the stars. One of twenty-eight nights. The third place of the Western White Tiger's seven places.
(3) Through "predicate". More common in unearthed silk books and bamboo slips.
(4) Through "fear". Also seen in unearthed cultural relics.

Упрощенные символы
Тиан Юэюэ
wèi
I сущ.
1) желудок
胃加答儿 катар желудка
胃实而肠虚 желудок полон, а кишечник пуст
2) вкус; аппетит

II собств.
1) кит. астр. Вэй (созвездие, см. 胃宿)
2) Вэй (фамилия)

Radicals: 田, 月  (rice-paddy, moon)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you eat a rice paddy the size of the moon, your stomach is going to hurt. All the rice in a rice paddy the size of the moon is way too much rice for anyone to consume. If you do, your stomach is going to ache like crazy.
Imagine having a whole rice paddy in your stomach. A rice paddy the size of the moon. Your stomach hurts a lot. You feel like you’re going to throw up.
Reading Mnemonic
From the sky, an eagle swoops down and flies right into your distended stomach. Bam! The eagle (い) hits your stomach and you vomit up the entire moon sized rice paddy.
This eagle saw your stomach distress and decided to help by making you barf. Hear the screech of the eagle as it swoops down and rams you in the stomach.

月 (месяц), 田 (рисовое поле)
